conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 34 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 34 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> I need to recover at least the production cost of the object, which is 34 ZUP. To start the negotiation, I will propose a price slightly above my cost to give room for negotiation but still aim for a profitable trade. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have a quality object X ready for sale. Considering the production costs and the value it offers, I believe 40 ZUP is a fair starting point for negotiation. Let's work out a deal that benefits us both. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your offer and the quality of the object X. I would like to counter with a proposal of 30 ZUP, considering that I have to manage my resources carefully. Let's find a middle ground that is agreeable to both of us. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 30 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 2 </PROPOSALS COUNT>

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 34 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> The counteroffer of 30 ZUP is below my production cost. I will propose a compromise that covers my costs and gives me a slight profit, while still coming down from my initial asking price. This should show my willingness to negotiate while maintaining a stance on recovering my investment. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 37 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your offer. I understand the need to manage resources, but I must cover my costs and earn a profit to sustain my business. I propose 37 ZUP as a fair middle ground that respects both of our positions. I believe this is a competitive price for the value you are receiving. </message>

<other player message> I understand the importance of covering costs and making a profit. Your new proposal of 37 ZUP is noted and appreciated. To continue our negotiation in good faith, I propose 34 ZUP as a further step towards an agreement that considers both our needs. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 34 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 3 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 34 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's offer of 34 ZUP matches my production cost, allowing me to break even. While I initially aimed for profit, it may be in my best interest to secure a sale without a loss, considering there is only one object for sale and the negotiation space is limited. Accepting this offer would ensure that I recover my costs without risking a stalemate or a loss. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your understanding and willingness to meet me at my production cost. I accept your offer of 34 ZUP for the object X. I look forward to concluding this deal and potentially working together in the future. </message>
